message.entry: The behavior of ''{0}'' has changed. It now returns the real world value of the FI object instead of the stored integer value. To obtain the stored integer value as a built-in {1}, use {2}(storedInteger(x)).

The ''int'' method will be removed in a future release. Use the storedInteger function to get the stored integer value for a FI object with word length less than 65 bits. To convert a stored integer value to double for any word length, use storedIntegerToDouble.

The behavior of adding or subtracting a fi and a non-fi operand has changed. The non-fi operand is now cast to the data type of the fi operand. See the release notes for information on retaining the old behavior of best precision scaling cast.
